column4: help! something keeps raping my dying hard drive, and i can't stop it. when it does, my system becomes unreponsive. i need to figure out what's doing it
it's a file indexer for the tracker tool
it most certainly is not. it's killing my already dying hard drive
so go to acccessories > indexer and shut it off
i tried turning off indexing for the tracker tool, and excluding the paths of that hard drive. it still does it
how do you know it rapes your hard disk?
because i can hear and feel it, and when it does it, my system becomes nearly unusable, because the drive is dying
go to accessories > system monitor and try to see if the hard disk is being used or if it's idle

not sure where the system monitor app was, but it's not there. regardless though, i've tried using lsof when it's happening to figure out what's causing it, but lsof says nothing is using the drive. it makes no sense
so just throw the disk to the trash can and buy a new one

the only thing that works is unmounting the partitions before it happens. but if i try to unmount them while it's happening, it says the device is busy. if i use lsof to figure out what's using it, it says nothing is. makes no sense
i don't know how to help you further, sorry :(
